item.description:
Interested in composting (or doing a better job composting) your kitchen and/or yard "waste?"  Curious about why your pile stalls out, gets stinky or attracts undesirables?  Whether your goal is to divert material away from the trash or to make quality compost for use in your garden, this session is for you.

Attendees can expect to learn the fundamentals of good compost and soil-building and why that matters for your composting process.  You will come away with a solid foundation for understanding the four key principles of good composting.  You will also see examples of do-it-yourself as well as purchased compost bins, consider the materials or "feedstocks" used to make compost and see/touch/smell what quality finished compost is like.

Bring your questions and compost "problems" to the group and if, after hearing the first part of this session, you need some trouble-shooting, we will do that as a group!

There will be a hands-on portion to this session so bring work gloves and clothes that can get a bit dirty if need be.  Bring notebook/camera to document your learning.

This session is suitable for urban, suburban and rural settings.  Handouts provided.

This session will be facilitated by Master Composter and meetup organizer Lisa F whose family has composted pretty much every scrap of yard and kitchen waste from their home for 20 years in various settings.  (This session can also be booked for neighborhood & community garden groups upon request).

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Skill-share: Home Composting Clinic
